Description: Primary brand color for key elements and actions
Do: Use from MaterialTheme.colorScheme for automatic light/dark adaptation
Don't: Hardcode hex values that don't adapt to theme

Description: Text and icons displayed on primary color
Do: Use for content on primary-colored surfaces
Don't: Use primary color text on primary surfaces

Description: Subtle primary color for containers and backgrounds
Do: Use for filled tonal buttons and less prominent containers
Don't: Use for high-emphasis elements requiring primary

Description: Text and icons on primary container surfaces
Do: Use for content displayed on primaryContainer

Description: Secondary brand color for less prominent elements
Do: Use for filters chips and less prominent actions

Description: Text and icons on secondary color surfaces
Do: Use for content on secondary-colored elements
Use to create visual interest and highlight specific elements
Don't: Overuse as it should complement not dominate

Description: Primary background color for app surfaces
Do: Use as main background for cards sheets and dialogs

Description: Container surface with subtle elevation tint
Do: Use for cards and elevated containers
Use for less prominent background areas
Use for navigation drawers and modal surfaces

Description: App background color behind scrollable content
Do: Use for the root background of the application

Description: Text and icons on background surfaces
Do: Use for primary text on background
Don't: Use low contrast colors on background

Description: Error state color for validation and alerts
Do: Use for error messages and destructive actions
Don't: Use for warnings or non-error states

Description: Text and icons on error surfaces
Do: Use for content displayed on error-colored surfaces
Don't: Use error color text on error surfaces

Description: Largest display text at 57sp for hero content
Do: Use for hero headlines and large numbers
Don't: Use for body text or small screens

Description: Display text at 45sp for prominent titles
Do: Use for large promotional headlines
Use for secondary display content

Description: Large headline at 32sp for page titles
Do: Use for top-level page titles

Description: Medium headline at 28sp for section titles
Do: Use for major section headers
Don't: Use for small labels or metadata

Do: Use for card titles and subsection headers

Description: Large title at 22sp for prominent UI elements
Do: Use for app bar titles and dialog headers

Use for minor titles and emphasized labels
Use for main body content and paragraphs
Use for secondary body content and descriptions
Use for captions and supporting text
Use for buttons and prominent labels
Use for chip labels and small buttons
Use for timestamps and minor annotations

Do: Use between related inline elements
Don't: Use as primary spacing between sections

Do: Use for padding within compact components
Use for list item vertical padding
Don't: Use inconsistently with other spacing values

Do: Use for horizontal margins and section spacing
Don't: Use values that break the 4dp grid

Do: Use between major content sections
Use to separate distinct content groups
Use between completely different content areas
Use for hero sections and major breaks
Ensure all interactive elements meet 48dp minimum
Apply on phones and compact layouts

Description: High-emphasis filled button for primary actions
Do: Use for the most important action on screen
Don't: Use multiple filled buttons competing for attention

Description: Medium-emphasis tonal button for secondary actions
Do: Use for important actions that aren't primary

Description: Elevated button with shadow for emphasis
Do: Use when button needs to stand out from surface
Don't: Use for primary actions over filled button

Do: Use for secondary actions and alternative choices
Don't: Use for primary or high-emphasis actions

Do: Use for tertiary actions and navigation links
Don't: Use for important actions requiring emphasis

Do: Use for content that needs visual separation
Don't: Use for content at same level as background

Do: Use when card needs to stand out from surface
Use for lower emphasis grouped content
Use for settings that take immediate effect

Description: Value selection along a continuous range
Do: Use with clear min/max indicators
Use for independent selections from multiple options
Use for selecting one option from a group

Description: Text input with outlined or filled styles
Do: Use with supporting text and validation states

Description: Text input optimized for search queries
Do: Place prominently with search icon

Description: Floating action button for primary screen action
Do: Use for the most common action on screen
Don't: Use multiple FABs or for minor actions

Description: Extended FAB with icon and label text
Do: Use when action needs explanation
Use for top-level destinations with icons and labels
Don't: Use more than 5 items or without labels

Description: Vertical navigation rail for medium screens
Do: Use on tablets and larger screens with 3-7 destinations
Don't: Use on phones or with more than 7 items

Description: Full navigation drawer for many destinations
Do: Use for extensive navigation with unlimited items
Don't: Use for only a few destinations

Description: Top app bar with title and actions
Do: Use for navigation title and contextual actions

Description: Medium top app bar with larger title
Do: Use for scrollable content with collapsing title

Description: Large top app bar with prominent title
Do: Use for top-level screens with hero titles
Don't: Use for detail or secondary screens

Description: Persistent bottom sheet for secondary content
Do: Use for content related to main screen
Use for focused tasks and selections
Don't: Use for content that should remain visible

Description: Brief message at bottom of screen
Do: Use for brief feedback that auto-dismisses

Do: Use for confirmations and critical inputs

Use for small components like chips
Use for buttons and small cards

Do: Use for cards and containers
Use for bottom sheets and large cards
Don't: Use for buttons and small components

Do: Use for dialogs and full-screen sheets

Do: Use for FABs and circular avatars

Do: Use for Material 3 tonal surface hierarchy

Do: Use for celebratory and playful moments
Use for subtle state changes like hover
Use for quick feedback and micro-interactions
Use for component expand/collapse
Use for most UI transitions
Use for complex or large-scale transitions
Use for dramatic or page-level transitions

Do: Use for browsing and viewing content

Description: Descriptive labels for TalkBack screen reader
Do: Provide contentDescription for all interactive elements

Do: Provide descriptions for informative images

Description: Mark headings for screen reader navigation
Do: Use heading semantics for section titles
Disable or simplify animations when enabled

Description: Support for system large text scaling
Do: Allow text to scale with system font size
Don't: Cap text scaling or break layout at large sizes

Description: Support for system bold text preference
Do: Respect system bold text setting
Use patterns and icons in addition to color
